required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Exercises for Chronic Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of the Functional Exercises in Young Adults Chronic Low Back Pain: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Non-specific low back pain is a common condition. Exercise is effective treatment for chronic low back pain. We hypothesized the functional exercise group will present pain reduction and functional improvement.
The purpose of this study is investigated the effectiveness of an functional exercise program for people with nonspecific chronic low back pain. Patients will be randomly divided into 2 groups: control group (minimal intervention - mini back school and analgesic) and group will receive a functional exercise protocol associated with minimal intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Low back of pain intensity measured with Numeric Pain Rating Scale
primary_outcome.description: It will be measured by the Brazilian version of the Numeric Pain Rating Scale (NPRS) 11 points. The NPRS goes from 0 to 10, where 0 is "no pain" and 10 is "the worst pain imaginable." Participants will be asked to answer about their pain levels based on the last seven days. Change in pain score or an improvement of 2 levels or more is accepted as clinically relevant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disability associated to low back pain measured with Oswestry Disability Index
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Oswestry Disability Index score

secondary_outcome.measure: Disability associated to low back pain measured with Roland Morris Disability
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Roland Morris Disability score

secondary_outcome.measure: Fear of movement measured with Fear-Avoidance Beliefs Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Fear-Avoidance Beliefs Questionnaire score

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life measured with Short form-36 questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Short form-36 questionnaire score

secondary_outcome.measure: Function measured with the 6-minute walk test
Function measured with the timed to up and go test
secondary_outcome.description: Change in timed to up and go test

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's global impression of recovery measured with a likert scale
secondary_outcome.description: It will be evaluated based on the global perceived effect by the Likert Scale Score. The Likert scale, used to evaluate the patient's global perceived effect with treatment. The patients answered the question 'After starting the treatment, how do you think your low back is?' with one of the following statements: much worse, a little worse, unchanged, a little better, much better.

intervention.description: Functional exercise protocol. This protocol started with corporal conscience exercise, breathing, abdominal activation, activities such as sitting, getting up, climbing stairs, reaching with arms, moving forward, bodyweight exercises, bridges and boards. This protocol will be performed during 12 weeks, two sessions per week.
Analgesic use when necessary and a single back scholl class
